intro: Memecylon phanerophlebium, commonly known as the broad-leaf memecylon, is a tropical shrub belonging to the Melastomataceae family. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in clusters, typically in shades of white or pink, which bloom during the wet season. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Memecylon phanerophlebium is often found in moist, shaded habitats in lowland tropical forests.
